citation.article-title: Pseudonocardia ammonioxydans sp. nov., isolated from coastal sediment
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudonocardia ammonioxydans sp. nov.
Pseudonocardia ammonioxydans (N.L. n. ammonia ammonia; N.L. part. adj. oxydans oxidizing; N.L. part. adj. ammonioxydans oxidizing ammonia).
Aerobic, Gram-positive.
Forms branched, brown substrate mycelium and white aerial mycelium on TSB and LB agar.
The mycelium fragments into rod-shaped elements.
Smooth spores are borne in short chains by acropetal budding from the substrate mycelium.
No pigment is produced.
Growth occurs at 10–40 °C.
Growth occurs on MNM and ammonia is oxidized to nitrate as the sole energy source.
Ammonia is also oxidized to nitrate during growth on a blend of MNM and LB media.
Growth occurs at NaCl concentrations ranging from 0 to 8 % with an optimum at 3·5 % NaCl.
Catalase-positive.

Acid is produced from d-fructose, d-glucose, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, d-ribose, d-arabitol, d-galacturonic acid, d-gluconic acid and glycerol, but not from N-acetyl-β-d-mannosamine, arbutin, l-fucose, gentiobiose, α-d-lactose, lactulose, maltotriose, methyl α-d-galactoside, methyl β-d-galactoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl α-d-mannoside, palatinose, d-psicose, d-raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-gagatose, turanose or xylitol.

Uses acetic acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, lactamide, d-lactic acid methyl ester, l-lactic acid, l-malic acid, pyruvic acid methyl ester, succinic acid mono-methyl ester, propionic acid, succinamic acid, succinic acid, N-acetyl-l-glutamic acid, l-alaninamide, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-alanyl glycine, l-asparagine, l-glutamic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-pyroglutamic acid, l-serine, putrescine, but not α-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, α-ketovaleric acid, d-malic acid or pyruvic acid.
Other physiological properties are listed in Table 1.
The cell-wall chemotype is type IV.
Predominant menaquinone is MK-8 (H4).

It contains phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylmethylethanolamine, phosphatidylinositol mannosides and diphosphatidylglycerol, but does not contain glucosamine-containing phospholipids or mycolic acids.
The major fatty acids are iso-hexadecanoic acid (16 : 0-iso, 41·1 %), iso-hexadecenoic acid (16 : 1-iso, 15·7 %) and heptadecenoic acid (17 : 1ω8c, 12·1 %).
The G+C content of the DNA is 69·6 mol% (Tm).
The type strain, H9T (=CGMCC 4.1877T=JCM 12462T), was isolated from coastal sediment collected from Jiao-Dong peninsula near Qingdao, Shandong province, China.
